meanings.definition: To express a choice or opinion by casting a vote.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we voted for our class president.
meanings.sent2: She always votes for her favorite contestant on the singing show.
meanings.sent3: The cat voted for more treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The sun voted to rise early, painting the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The students voted eagerly for their favorite school lunch option.

meanings.sent1: Last week, she voted for the new school mascot.
meanings.sent2: He voted for the winning team in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The dog voted for extra playtime by wagging its tail enthusiastically.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden voted to bloom early, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The community center voted unanimously to host a charity event.
